author: adityapatwardhan
body:
When installing powershell-lts packages, we get an error due to the package having man help content same as install stable powershell.

This only happens on a side by side install with `6.2.4`.

There is a workaround for installing

```
sudo apt-get install -o Dpkg::Options::="--force-overwrite" -y powershell-lts

```

# Steps to reproduce

```powershell
sudo apt-get install -y powershell-lts -f
Reading package lists... Done
Building dependency tree
Reading state information... Done
The following packages were automatically installed and are no longer required:
  bridge-utils libdumbnet1 ubuntu-fan
Use 'sudo apt autoremove' to remove them.
The following NEW packages will be installed:
  powershell-lts
0 upgraded, 1 newly installed, 0 to remove and 39 not upgraded.
Need to get 0 B/61.1 MB of archives.
After this operation, 166 MB of additional disk space will be used.
(Reading database ... 62414 files and directories currently installed.)
Preparing to unpack .../powershell-lts_7.0.0-rc.3-1.ubuntu.18.04_amd64.deb ...
Unpacking powershell-lts (7.0.0-rc.3-1.ubuntu.18.04) ...
dpkg: error processing archive /var/cache/apt/archives/powershell-lts_7.0.0-rc.3-1.ubuntu.18.04_amd64.deb (--unpack):
 trying to overwrite '/usr/local/share/man/man1/pwsh.1.gz', which is also in package powershell 6.2.4-1.ubuntu.18.04
dpkg-deb: error: paste subprocess was killed by signal (Broken pipe)
Errors were encountered while processing:
 /var/cache/apt/archives/powershell-lts_7.0.0-rc.3-1.ubuntu.18.04_amd64.deb
```

# Expected behavior

```none
Installs side by side with 6.2.4
```

# Actual behavior

```none
Error while installing.
```

# Environment data

<!-- provide the output of $PSVersionTable -->

```none

```

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body: Make sense to distribute help content in separate package?

title: Powershell LTS packages do not install with stable package side by side
